head.supplied: August 26 [186]3 ¶ My dear Doctor ¶ ¶ Herewith I beg to return to you the two letters laid before the Council yesterday. ¶ That from Mr Henderson does not seem to require any reply and with referenc...

div.p: No. 63/712, unit 3, p. 133, VPRS 2225 outward letterpress copy books, Acclimatisation Society of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
Herewith I beg to return to you the two letters laid before the Council yesterday.
Letters not found. Check minutes of meeting.
That from Mr Henderson does not seem to require any reply and with reference to that from Mr Gibson the Council are unanimously of opinion that his request cannot be complied with in as much as it would form a troublesome and dangerous precedent and therefore whilst regretting the inconvenience to which Mr Gibson is put (which is hardly so great however as he makes out) they are obliged so far as they are concerned to refuse the key.
Gibson had requested that he be provided with private keys for the Park gates. He persisted with his request and subsequently the Council 'though almost in opposition to their better judgement' allowed him the use of the key to the 'Brunswick gate for one month on trial' (No. 63/923, p. 358, G. Sprigg to J. Gibson MD, 20 December 1863).

The Secretary has been requested to send for the [Curassow]. With reference to the [elk] it would relieve our too crowded paddocks at the Park if you would consent that a male [elk] should be sent to her but if you would prefer getting rid of her why then the Secretary will send for it.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
[…]
The letter-copy is unsigned, but the letter would have been signed by Sprigg as Secretary.
Mr Godfrey & Mr [Bosisto] have been requested to arrange with you about the [gum/gun] for Phillip Island.
